item.title: U.S. Enlists Mexico, EU and Japan in Its Minerals Race With China
item.description: The pacts seek to establish a “preferential trade zone” that would counter China’s dominance in the sector.

item.title: Opinion | Japan’s Low-Energy, High-Impact Election
item.description: A Takaichi win would send Beijing a message but not fix the economy.

item.title: ‘The Wall Dancers’ Review: Surfing China’s Censored Internet
item.description: Seeking connection and information, Chinese users navigate a version of the web obstructed by the so-called Great Firewall.

item.title: The American and Chinese Economies Are Hurtling Toward a Messy Divorce
item.description: The breakup is focused on sensitive matters now considered national-security issues, including semiconductors, food and energy.

item.title: Trump Says He Spoke With China’s Xi About Iran
item.description: Trump says the two leaders have an “extremely good” relationship, as he plans a visit to China in April.

item.title: EU Launches In-Depth Foreign Subsidies Probe Into China’s Goldwind
item.description: The commission said it was investigating whether the wind-turbine company received foreign backing that would give it an unfair advantage in the EU.

item.title: South Africa Risks Angering Trump by Hosting Navies of Iran, Russia, China
item.description: The military exercises come at a time of already strained relations with the U.S.

item.title: The American and Chinese Economies Are Hurtling Toward a Messy Divorce
item.description: The breakup is focused on sensitive matters now considered national-security issues, including semiconductors, food and energy.
